thread.title: Seattle shootings: NRA is root issue
thread.title_full: Seattle shootings: NRA is root issue | The Seattle Times

author: Letters editor
title: Seattle shootings: NRA is root issue
text:
Thank you for publishing a timely editorial concerning a critical social issue [“ Fix root causes of violence ,” Opinion, Aug. 23]. As The Times rightly points out, the firearms carnage is unacceptable and perhaps, ultimately, unsustainable.
The Times states that “this isn’t a lost cause,” but deftly avoided the gorilla in the room. Until it is confronted in a meaningful way, nothing much will get measurably better. I refer to the National Rifle Association. It not only manages to block or confound any sane firearm restrictions, it is now suing the city of Seattle regarding the ammunition tax.
I understand the NRA is a very deep-pocketed lobbying organization, and, as such, a formidable foe. It appears that a lack of vigorous pushback is mainly due to the reluctance, or cowardice, of our elected representatives.
I’d hate to think that we live in a country that loves its firearms and has just gotten used to the increasing death toll.

Letters editor
